Text: King Oriana and Perv are in a deluxe suite.

Perv had used a powerfully addictive herb to enthrall
the king.

I have no complaints about the drug's efficacy, but
I wish there was something to be done about this
overbearing sweet odor...
Spray some cologne or the like to cover it up.

Still, to think a single chemical is all it took to
reduce you to a lifeless puppet...
I must say, it's quite pathetic...Your Grace.

But never you fear. I'm certain Rose will return to
your pitiful side soon enough.
Rose...

If she had only given us the key like a good girl,
I might have let her walk away unharmed.

But no, I suppose I couldn't have, not when she was
already showing symptoms of possession. The Cult
couldn't ask for a finer subject. So we would've
caught her either way, you see.

(And if Rose does fail to show, all I need do is have
my dear marionette murder the king of Midgar.)

(That will put the two kingdoms at each other's
throats—a conflict that Oriana will likely not
survive.)

(It will also spell the end of my current social
status.)

(But that is no issue at all. I already have plans in
place to bend the next ruler of Midgar to my will.)

(My chances of success will be highest if I set
things into motion while Princess Iris is in her
match.)

(There is the matter of Mundane Mann, though. None of
our checks were able to turn up anything about him.)

(He is a denizen of the underworld and undoubtedly
a dangerous one at that.)

(What motive could have brought him forth?
We'll need to strengthen our forces...)

(This all gives me cause to worry about what those
Shadow Garden louts might get up to. All signs
indicate they are acting in concert with Rose,
and yet...)
You stink.

How dare you speak to His Grace in such a manner.
Guards, eject this woman at once...!
Perv.

Allow me to introduce you to...Beatrix the War
Goddess. And my guest.
(What?! Beatrix?!)
(The Beatrix said to awaken the hero's blood?!)

(I had heard she was in the capital, but is this
truly her? She certainly does not have the look
of a peerless swordmaster to merit such a title.)

(But...if Iris accepts her as the real thing, it
would be smart to follow suit.)
Sorry.

Not at all. It is I who should apologize, though I
acted out of ignorance. Please enjoy the festival.

With faults admitted by both sides, peace settles
over the scene.

Beatrix's rude remark is probably assumed to
have been directed at Perv.

(But Beatrix?! Why would she be at this tournament
of all places?)

(Perhaps I should find an opening to eliminate her...
But is such a thing even possible?! She is even more
of a threat than Iris!)
(Is disposing of King Midgar off the table?)
(No, all will be fine so long as Rose appears.)

(All I need to do is secure the girl and move things
forward in Oriana according to plan.)

(Everything is fine. She will come, I know it. There
is nothing that can go wrong.)
(What...?)
(Why must I envy the ignorant masses...?)
That Claire Kagenou is really something.

She has the confidence of Princess Iris and is by
all accounts making steady strides in ability.

(She does look to have potential, but I can't see her
becoming an obstacle.)

(Life would be so much easier if this was all I had
to contend with.)

Thunderous cheers greet Iris as she enters the
arena.

This immense show of support is evidence that she
is the main attraction of the tournament.
(This fanfare is my strength...and my duty.)

(I must make them think...and continue to think that
the kingdom is safe and secure in my hands.)
(And to do so...)

(Mundane Mann is an unmistakably dangerous foe.
Even standing before him in the arena, I can't gauge
his strength.)
(There is something unsettling about him...)
(But that doesn't make him unbeatable.)

(My apologies, Mundane, but I'm going to hit you with
everything I have right from the start.)

(I will end this with a single stroke. I won't even
allow you an opening to reveal whatever it is
you're hiding.)

And now for our second match—Iris Midgar versus
Mundane Mann! Ready? Begin!!
